video.title: Twitch Plays (Viewers play/Chat plays) Chrono Trigger on an actual Wii Day 9, Hour 0 to Hour 12, type !help to learn how to play (Part 23)

message.body: @zecmo You can save or edit a macro by using the command !savemacro <macro name> <macro inputs>. Example: !savemacro WalkInCircles Up Right Down Left will save or edit the macro WalkInCircles with the inputs Up Right Down Left, which can then be used later.

fragments.text: @zecmo You can save or edit a macro by using the command !savemacro <macro name> <macro inputs>. Example: !savemacro WalkInCircles Up Right Down Left will save or edit the macro WalkInCircles with the inputs Up Right Down Left, which can then be used later.

message.body: You can rename a macro by using the command !renamemacro <old macro name> <new macro name>. Example: !renamemacro WalkInCircles WalkingCircles will rename the macro WalkInCircles to WalkingCircles.

fragments.text: You can rename a macro by using the command !renamemacro <old macro name> <new macro name>. Example: !renamemacro WalkInCircles WalkingCircles will rename the macro WalkInCircles to WalkingCircles.

message.body: You can execute a saved macro by using the command !execmacro <macro name> <times to repeat(optional)>. Example: !execmacro WalkingCircles 2 will execute the macro WalkingCircles 1 time then repeat it 2 times. If there's no number provided, the macro will be executed only 1 time.

fragments.text: You can execute a saved macro by using the command !execmacro <macro name> <times to repeat(optional)>. Example: !execmacro WalkingCircles 2 will execute the macro WalkingCircles 1 time then repeat it 2 times. If there's no number provided, the macro will be executed only 1 time.

message.body: You can see the list of inputs of a macro by using the command !listmacro <macro name>. Example: !listmacro WalkingCircles will list the inputs of the macro WalkingCircles, which is Up Right Down Left. You can see the list of all macros saved by using the command !listallmacros.

fragments.text: You can see the list of inputs of a macro by using the command !listmacro <macro name>. Example: !listmacro WalkingCircles will list the inputs of the macro WalkingCircles, which is Up Right Down Left. You can see the list of all macros saved by using the command !listallmacros.

message.body: You can change if a macro can be edited only by the owner of the macro or by anyone by using the command !togglemacroeditability <macro name>. Example: !togglemacroeditability WalkingCircles will make it so the macro WalkingCircles can be edited by anyone, and sending !togglemacroeditability WalkingCircles again will make it so the macro WalkingCircles can be edited only by the owner of the macro.

fragments.text: You can change if a macro can be edited only by the owner of the macro or by anyone by using the command !togglemacroeditability <macro name>. Example: !togglemacroeditability WalkingCircles will make it so the macro WalkingCircles can be edited by anyone, and sending !togglemacroeditability WalkingCircles again will make it so the macro WalkingCircles can be edited only by the owner of the macro.

message.body: !togglemacroeditability <macro name> can be executed only by the owner of the macro. By default, when a new macro is created, it can only be edited by the owner of the macro.

fragments.text: !togglemacroeditability <macro name> can be executed only by the owner of the macro. By default, when a new macro is created, it can only be edited by the owner of the macro.

message.body: You can set a single input per message by using the command !setsettablemacro <input> <position to edit>. Example: a+b;300 0 will set A+B for 300 milliseconds at position 0. Starting position is 0, final position is 95.

fragments.text: You can set a single input per message by using the command !setsettablemacro <input> <position to edit>. Example: a+b;300 0 will set A+B for 300 milliseconds at position 0. Starting position is 0, final position is 95.

message.body: You can list all inputs currently set by using the command !listsettablemacro <up to which position to list(optional)>. Example: !listsettablemacro 5 will list the first 5 inputs currently set. Starting position is 0, final position is 95. If there's no number provided, all of the inputs currently set will be listed.

fragments.text: You can list all inputs currently set by using the command !listsettablemacro <up to which position to list(optional)>. Example: !listsettablemacro 5 will list the first 5 inputs currently set. Starting position is 0, final position is 95. If there's no number provided, all of the inputs currently set will be listed.

message.body: You can execute all inputs currently set by using the command !execsettablemacro <up to which position to execute> <times to repeat(optional)>. Example: !execsettablemacro 5 2 will execute the first 5 inputs currently set 1 time then repeat 2 more times. Starting position is 0, final position is 95. If there's no second number provided, the macro will be executed only 1 time. Currently, you can't save macros that were set using the !setsettablemacro command.

fragments.text: You can execute all inputs currently set by using the command !execsettablemacro <up to which position to execute> <times to repeat(optional)>. Example: !execsettablemacro 5 2 will execute the first 5 inputs currently set 1 time then repeat 2 more times. Starting position is 0, final position is 95. If there's no second number provided, the macro will be executed only 1 time. Currently, you can't save macros that were set using the !setsettablemacro command.

message.body: We have a Discord server and there is currently a poll up for which game to be played after this (Date TBD), the options are: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past (Super NES) (Previously tied with Chrono Trigger), Final Fantasy 6 (Super NES) (known as Final Fantasy 3 in North America) and Final Fantasy (NES), you can vote for more than one option, Discord server link here: https://discord.gg/yHETNuZCUK

fragments.text: We have a Discord server and there is currently a poll up for which game to be played after this (Date TBD), the options are: The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past (Super NES) (Previously tied with Chrono Trigger), Final Fantasy 6 (Super NES) (known as Final Fantasy 3 in North America) and Final Fantasy (NES), you can vote for more than one option, Discord server link here: https://discord.gg/yHETNuZCUK
